content: hence its not self knowledge, as ‘who i am’ isn’t contained in that.

1. the organism is in imminent danger and needs to take quick action, hence the adrenaline. in this case it is perfectly natural and healthy to experience fear here, i think its fairly intuitive and youd know why youre scared if there was a genuine threat to your life. its like the pain of touching something hot, you don’t need a reason for taking action. you experience the pain first then add a story to it afterwards, but truthfully the signal on how to act is embedded in the experience of fear and doesnt need verbal explanation. the confusion arises when theres an emotion caused by self image paired with non-egoic emotion. i.e shame for hurting others + anger towards ones we’ve hurt creates an emotional signal that isn’t at all intuitive as theres conflicting signals.

2. self realisation isnt the end of planning, thought is still experienced. it just doesnt have any emotional significance. why does one buy groceries? just seems like an intelligent thing to do really

3. yes there’d be knowledge of how much weight you can safely lift without potential injury, while it’s knowledge thats relevant to you and depicting the organism, the actual subjective experience of ‘me’ isn’t contained in the memory
